nodes.message: This manual script is invoked from two locations, so target scope can't be used.

nodes.text: There are four different shapes of keyholes surrounding a circle in the center of the safe.
This looks like it takes four different keys - or one extra-fancy Rogue Tool Kit.
Hmmmm... that's odd. The keyholes are blocked. I can't get a pick or a key into them.
There must be some trick or method to opening the keyholes.

options.text: Use an Item on the Safe

nodes.text: All of the key slots seem to be blocked. There must be something else I have to do before trying to pick the locks.
I'll just pick these locks in no time...

Ok, that's just crazy. I can pick any one of the locks, but as soon as I try another one, the rest lock up again. There aren't enough tools in the magical lockpick set to open all of the locks at once.
I've already unlocked the safe. Best not to press my luck trying it again with different tools.
When I push in the center depression with the Houdini, the keyholes open!
Shame the holes close back up the minute I release the Houdini...
I'll just pick these locks in no time...
There we go!
I've already unlocked the safe, I don't think there's anything else I can do with the Houdini here.
Let's see if I can win with the Won Ring!
Darn, it's too small to fit into the center circle.
With the coin in place, there's nowhere to put the ring.
I can't insert the Trap Tapper since there are no open slots on the safe right now.
Let's see if I can safely disarm the trap on the safe...
I don't know if there is a trap on this safe, but it probably won't hurt to use the Trap Tapper to find out...
Ah! So there is a trap - and it's on the shamrock-shaped keyhole...
I can't use the Magical Key since there are no open keyholes on the safe right now.
This Magical Key is the easy way to open this safe.
That does it.
Ah! Pressing the Lucky Coin into the middle slot opens the keyholes. Lucky for me - it was key that I kept the coin this hole time.
Good thing I looked at the safe again - there's a trap connected to the shamrock-shaped keyhole.
This is a really secure safe. I just hope it still contains what I think it contains.
It's too hard to open a locked safe. A few well-placed Booms might blow it up though...
And it might blow up me and the entire house, so that's probably a bad idea.
If only I had a Trap Tapper to disarm this with... I really do need to get one.
So my father had my name as the trap solution. I guess he liked me.
This one is tricky... gotta focus! I don't want to blow this.
Uh oh...
How ironic would it be if I died from my own father's trap? I guess I should have looked at the safe more carefully before I tried to open it.

nodes.message: Since we're not using the bedtime timer, make sure time doesn't progress too late.

nodes.text: So let's see what's hiding in this safe...
It looks like... It is! It's the Raven statue!
Well, well, well, if you don't look the spitting image of your da on the day he found that Raven. Oh, Shawn boy, 'tis proud I am of you. I knew you could do it.
Uncle Shamus, I presume?
The very brother of your father, that I am, lad.
What happened to my father? Did you kill him?
Did I murder Donal? Did that right bastard Gerhard tell you that I killed me own brother? Donal was the dearest friend I ever had!
'Twas like me own heart died with Donal.
Then what happened to my father?

We had a... disagreement... over the Raven. Your father could be the most mule-headed, stubborn, son of Eire that ever lived! Words were said that came to blows as I tried to beat the sense back into him.
He gave me a smack to the face that sent me reeling and I sent a fist to his breadbasket that knocked him back from me.
In my nightmares, I still see the look on his face as he slipped on the rocks and stepped backwards over the sea cliff to fall to the rocks and the sea below.
There's nothing I would not have given to save Donal. Gladly would I have died in his place.
What were you fighting with my father about?

Donal wanted to give it up - the Raven, the Thief Kingdom, everything! - all because that thrice-cursed Germanish Urwald talked to Nora and him. We had it all - and Donal was going to walk away from it.
Damn Urwald to the tortures of Hades! It's his fault Donal is dead! Donal was a great Raven of Thieves. Together, we controlled all of Sardonia. Not even the Prince dared cross us.
With Donal dead and the raven statue hidden away, it all fell apart. The Con Game guild was all I could hold onto.
So you're the Chief Thief of the Con Games guild and my patron at the university?
'twas the least that I could do for the son of Donal - to take you, blood of his blood, under my protection. I'd have raised you as me own son if only your mama didn't blame me for Donal's death.
Why didn't you tell me that you were my uncle when I first tried to join your guild and become a thief? Why send me on that mission to find the Lucky Coin?

I didn't know what you knew about your father and me. I did know that your mama Nora would have my hide if she knew you were talking to me about being a thief. She never liked that Donal was once the very Raven of Thieves himself.
I thought to meself that if anyone could find your father's Lucky Coin, it would be you.
Why did you want the Lucky Coin?
Donal said it was the luckiest thing he ever found. He got it on the day he met Nora and carried it everywhere.
I keep thinking, if only he had carried it on the day he fell, then he'd still be alive today.
It's like that coin was a piece of Donal's heart. It's all I wanted to hold onto Donal's memory. I've searched this house a hundred times, but I never found it.

Then I see you walking into the guildhall, looking like Donal come back to life! I said to meself, if any could find that coin, it would be you. And with you and the Lucky Coin working with me, I'd have Donal back.
Did you know that the Raven has been hidden here in this house all this time?
And here I thought that Urwald had taken it!
The grief that stupid missing statue has caused me! I should have been the Raven of all the thieves of Sardonia, not some minor Chief Thief in a third-rate Thieves' Guild.
What's done is done, but now, with the Raven, I'll be the King I was meant to be.
I knew you could find the Raven. You're so much like Donal.
Hand me the statue, and you and me, we will rule Sardonia!
Here, you can have the Raven.

options.text: Refuse to Give Shamus the Statue

nodes.text: No, I don't think so...

options.text: Charm Shamus Into Letting Shawn Keep the Raven

nodes.text: It was nice to finally meet you, Uncle Shamus. Thank you for dealing with Mr. Terk for me. You are probably the only reason why I wasn't kicked out of the university a long time ago.
I'm sorry to disappoint you like this, but I'm taking the Raven with me. You see, I lost my father so long ago I can hardly remember him. This is the only thing I've ever gotten from him.
So in the memory of my father, I'm going to abide by his last wish. There will be no more King of Thieves in Sardonia.
Farewell, Uncle Shamus.
You can't do this! You can't just walk away like this!
Oh, but I can, Uncle. And for the love of my father, you're going to let me.
That was quite a try at turning on the old Eirish charm.
You have all the charm of a dead Dire Rat. I'll not listen to any more of your clumsy prattling!

options.text: Cleverly Convince Shamus to let You Leave with the Raven

nodes.text: This Raven was my father's, right? He hid it away so well that not even you - his beloved brother - could find it.
You were his partner and his friend, but he never told you about the safe in this house. He obviously didn't want you to have it.
You've done really well for yourself all this time without my father or the Raven. You're the Chief Thief of your own guild. You've clearly got money, influence, and prestige.
You don't need this Raven to be powerful. You are already powerful.
So I'm taking my father's Raven away with me. I'll make my own decisions what will happen to me and the Raven. I'll make my own future.
And you won't stop me because you know that this is something Donal will want me to do. I am my father's son.
You can't just walk away like this...
I can - and will - just walk away. You won't stop me, Uncle. You know that what I'm doing is right for my father and for me.
Farewell.
You ain't got the street smarts to hold onto that statue for five minutes against real thieves. And you ain't close to smart enough to keep it away from me!
You killed my father in an argument about this Raven... Now you want me to just hand the Raven over to his murderer?
I didn't kill your father! It was an accident!
You fought my father over this stupid statue. He'd be alive today. My father would be alive!
I didn't kill Donal!
He died because of you!
You've lied to yourself all these years - You're nothing but a murderer! It's time for you to pay for my father 's death.
Stop it! Stop saying that! You're nothing like Donal. You're just a stupid punk. I'll shut your mouth for you!
You killed my father - prepare to pay!
I'm going back to the university now, and I'm taking the Raven with me. You can live the rest of your miserable, nasty life knowing that you've lost everything you've ever cared about.
Goodbye forever, Uncle Shamus.
Hold on there, kid. You think you got the moxie to challenge a Chief Thief? You ain't got what it takes!

Let me get this straight - you are Chief Thief of a guild of professional thieves. You've searched for the Raven Statue for more than fifteen years, and the statue has been sitting in this house the whole time?
Yet here I found the Raven statue on my own. Can't say that I'm impressed with your thief skills when you can't even find a concealed safe in your own brother's house.
Don't look down your nose at me, Mister. You got caught on your first attempt to be a thief. You should be rotting in a jail.
When Donal died, I died a little, too. I couldn't go near this house. It was like his ghost was blaming me for Donal's death.
So yes, I sent thieves here, a lot of them. None of them could find the Raven or the Lucky Coin. So I figured that Urwald had the Raven and the coin was lost.
Then you walk into my guild, and it was like Donal had come back to me. That's why I sent you here - I knew that if anyone could find the coin, it would be you.
Why didn't you talk to me and tell me what was going on?
I didn't know what you knew about me and your father. Nora always blamed me for Donal's death. I figured you did, too. That's why I stayed out of sight when you came into the guildhall.
But here you are, Raven and all. Together, we'll be the greatest thieves that ever ruled Sardonia.
Yeah, right. Well, guess what, uncle? I'm a lot like my father. I've got better things to do with my life than to spend it lording over a bunch of thugs, villains, and thieves.
Give me that statue or else!
No, Shamus.  You're never going to get this Raven. You don't deserve it.
We'll see about that!
Or else what? You'll knock me off a cliff to my death? You've tried to tell everyone that you didn't kill my father. Are you willing to kill your brother's son for this Raven?
You've survived all this time without the Raven statue. You don't need it. I figure that this statue is mine now to do with what I want.
So farewell, Uncle. Your greed for this statue killed my father and destroyed my life. I hope we never meet again.
